thread.title: Aljamain Sterling’s Lifestyle Choices Affecting UFC 300 Prep and Cardio, Admits “It Took a Toll on My Lungs”
thread.title_full: Aljamain Sterling’s Lifestyle Choices Affecting UFC 300 Prep and Cardio, Admits “It Took a Toll on My Lungs”

author: Harriet Collins
title: Aljamain Sterling’s Lifestyle Choices Affecting UFC 300 Prep and Cardio, Admits “It Took a Toll on My Lungs”
text:
Lifestyle choices after losing title ‘took a toll on my lungs,’ affecting UFC 300 prep
Lifestyle choices after losing title ‘took a toll on my lungs,’ affecting UFC 300 prep
Former UFC bantamweight champion Aljamain Sterling has opened up about the challenges he has faced after losing his title, admitting that his lifestyle choices have taken a toll on his lungs and affected his preparation for UFC 300. Sterling’s struggles with weight gain and unhealthy habits have impacted his cardio and To end performance as he gears up for his featherweight debut against Calvin Kattar on April 13.
Challenges in Transitioning to Featherweight
Sterling’s transition to featherweight has been a struggle, with the physical differences between bantamweight and featherweight fighters posing challenges for him. His recent lifestyle choices have further compounded the difficulties he faces as he prepares to compete in a new weight class.
Impact on Cardio and Training
Sterling has acknowledged that his recent lifestyle choices, including indulging in sweets and unhealthy habits, have significantly impacted his cardio and training. He has experienced exhaustion and struggles to maintain his performance during sparring sessions, highlighting the toll that his habits have taken on his To end fitness and preparation for UFC 300.
